name: Laurie's Creamy Slow Cooker Queso
author: Laurie
summary: After lots of tweaking trying to replicate my favorite Mexican restaurant's recipe, I came up with this masterpiece! It's quite addictive - just warning! And I think it turned out even better than my favorite restaurant's version. I'm confident this will become your go-to queso recipe. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 pound processed cheese (such as Velveeta®), cubed
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as Rotel®)
⅓ (8 ounce) package cold cream cheese, cubed
2 small jalapeno peppers, seeded and chopped
⅓ cup canned chopped green chiles
½ cup Mexican-style shredded four-cheese blend
directions: Turn a slow cooker (such as Crock Pot®) on High; coat lightly with cooking spray
Fill with processed cheese, mushroom soup, diced tomatoes with green chiles, evaporated milk, sour cream, milk, and cream cheese
Cook until mostly melted, about 1 hour
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Saute poblano peppers, yellow onion, and jalapeno peppers until softened, about 5 minutes
Transfer vegetables to the slow cooker; add green chiles, garlic, and cilantro
Cover and continue cooking until cheese is completely melted, about 20 minutes
Add the Mexican cheese blend; stir until heated through, about 10 minutes more
